Good software == Good Interfaces

December 21, 2017

First thing you should worry about writing a program that you ain’t gonna hate is to build good interfaces. I mean interfaces in the most generic meaning: the boundaries of your software. How the outside world will interact with it? The outside world can be just another function or it could be a user or a HTTP interface. You should build your interfaces first. Then fill the gaps.

So what’s important when building an interface? It will make it’s users happy. Once again the user might be yourself. Another developer of your team. A third party API integrator. The end user. When a program has good interfaces it’s pleasurable to use. It’s simple to test. It don’t require any other input than the strictly necessary. In summary to build good software you have to build elegant interfaces.
